acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96-hour ErC50=20mg/L of algae (Selenastrum) (IUCLID, 2000).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rabbits lethal dose: >2000mg/kg (RTECS, 2005) and rabbit LD50 value: >2000mg/kg (IUCLID, 2000), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on rat LC50 (1 hour) value: 11.02 mg/L (4 hour equivalent: 5.51mg/L, 1514ppm), it was classified . Since 5.51 mg/L was judged to be steam with almost no mist from vapor pressure, it was classified according to the ppm concentration standard. it was classified as Category 3.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Rat
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 455 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: RTECS (2005), HSDB (2005)

SPECIES: Rat
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 484 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: IUCLID (2000)

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 3, since acute toxicity was Category 3 and not rapidly degrading (BOD of 2-nitro propane: 8% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though less bio-accumulative (log Kow=0.87(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Flash point: >=23degC and <=60degC, UNRTDG Class: 3, PGIII

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since there was a negative result with the micronucleus test on rat and mouse red corpuscles which is an in vivo mutagenicity test using somatic cells (PATTY 4th, 1994), it was classified as out of Category.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is the description that in humans eye irritations were acknowledged by exposure to vapor (ACGIH (7th, 2001), PATTY (4th, 1994), and DFGOT (vol.13, 1999)), and the description that the eyes are stimulated seriously (ICSC (J) and (1996)). So it was set as Category 2A-2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: IUCLID (2000) had description that skin irritation was not admitted by the test which used the rabbit. But there was description that the skin might be stimulated (HSFS (2002), SITTIG (4th, 2002)). So it could not be classified since data was insufficient.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Although there was description that skin sensitization was not acknowledged in IUCLID (2000) with the guinea pigs, we had no description which clearly negates sensitizing property in Proprity 1, therefore we presupposed that we could not classify it.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the description that in the 21.5-months inhalation exposure test using the rat, the toxicity which endorses the classification of the concentration exceeding the Category 2 guidance value range is not observed (ACGIH (7th, 2001) and PATTY (4th, 1994)), and in the 28-days oral study (good laboratory practice tests) using the rat, the toxicity is not acknowledged with the dosage in the the Category 2 guidance value range (IUCLID (2000)), it was classified into the outside of Category.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 3 Respiratory tract irritation, Narcotic effects
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since the symptom, which is considered to be respiratory irritant and anesthetic actions, was seen in the inhalation exposure test using the rabbits as described in ACGIH (7th, 2001), it was set as Category 3 (respiratory irritant, anesthetic actions).
